If the available resources do not allow to check the validity of a vendor – an Initiator should request a vendor's business certificate or a link to new resources where a vendor's validity could be checked.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The following forms of information are used for checking vendor's systems – vendors’ \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"bank details\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". Therefore, the obligatory step was implemented into the Vendor Management process by EPAM top management – every new bank data of any vendor should be validated by providing vendor's formal letterhead with bank details signed by an authorized person. Alternatively, it can be a Bank Confirmation Letter (bank details confirmed by a vendor's bank).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM is a public company and it has to maintain financial control. This request can help to avoid mistakes/wrong payments and decrease the risk of fraud/hacker attacks.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\n\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
